intro: Rhynchospora elatior var. burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as marshes and grasslands. It features slender, grass-like stems with spike-like inflorescences bearing small, three-lobed flowers. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
